Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	If the fistula is of great depth and follows a straight course, you must incise it as far inward as possible to the prepuce, and then remove all corrupted flesh from it; afterwards apply hot poultices wrapped in sharp medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula which you have grasped with forceps.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this for several applications until the sharp medicine has dissolved everything that remains in the cavity of the fistula from corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with applications that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it does not heal with this treatment, then you should cauterize it as we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you need to determine this, then you should explore it and dry it out as we have recommended, without prohibiting any cause related to veins or nerves or major limbs, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is corruption and blackening, then you should excise that until all the corruption is removed; afterwards treat it with what promotes flesh growth until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and pus continues to discharge as before, then you will know that you have not fully eradicated the corruption; therefore, uncover it again and carefully examine its condition and cleanse it thoroughly with your own hand, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it heals, that is good; but if not, then you will know that the corruption is in the deep recesses of the body, which you have not reached, and therefore you should only dress that area.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, it is up to you to remove that; then you pull it out with subtle forceps which are suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and do not leave any of them behind for any reason due to your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any cause of moisture opposes you, and in their incision there is neither fear nor hesitation, then incise those ligaments or muscles if necessary, and release the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if it is not the right time for you to remove the bones at that moment, then apply something that can alleviate the condition on the wound, and leave it be until such a time when there is flesh and ligaments around those bones, and keep the wound so that it does not become hardened, and ensure that the section you incised during your operation remains open.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Having said that, if you are concerned, apply a cloth submerged in hot water with oil, or a cloth submerged in Egyptian ointment, or any of the green ointments, because when these ligaments will begin to heal, and the bones are separated from their attachment, and this traction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the bone of an elephant or similar, and what is corrupted of it is only its surface, then scrape that off with a rasp only from behind until the blackness and corruption are removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if what is corrupted of it is a large part, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that area and completely incise within the place where the corruption has spread, and then treat it until it becomes consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	Here is what is recommended for you concerning what happens to a person in their condition so that you may use this as an example and assistance regarding your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around xxx years old complained of pain in his body, and the part inside him was affected by an injury involving matter inside the body that had reached the affected area, and this matter formed into a large abscess, and it did not have an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	Then the condition extended over time due to the error of the physicians, causing the abscess to become hardened, and pus accumulated within it. His treatment was postponed until an opening was made in the swelling, through which all the putrefaction and moisture of the body were discharged.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Then many physicians attended to him for two years, and none of them had knowledge or skill in the art until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	I saw the swelling on him and the matter that was flowing from those openings in large quantities; his body was completely emaciated, and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a probe into one of those openings and it reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I immediately examined all the openings and found that they extended to various parts of the swelling.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I decided to incise one of the openings and discovered part of the bone that was corrupted; it had turned earth-like, decayed, and blackened. Part of the swelling had also penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I used what was shown to me and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I cut out not from the bone but that corruption which I had recognized and prepared to remove.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I paused the restoration of the wound with healing medicines for a long time, and it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reopened and exposed the bone again beyond the initial exposure, and found continuing corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I treated what appeared to me from that corruption, and then I attempted to perform the healing and restoration, and it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I exposed it on another occasion and did not cease to excise the bone little by little specifically, attempting the restoration of it, and it was not restored until I excised around a palm's width of it, along with that portion containing its marrow, and then I restored it with medicines, and it healed quickly and became well.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it is not necessary to repeat the operation and section of it except due to the disposition of its fever and the lack of its tolerance and fear of death, for it suffered at all hours from excess of fainting spells and bad evacuations.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus he was completely healed, and nothing remained in place of the bone but living flesh; and his condition improved in his body, and his strength returned; and he recovered to his previous state and did not experience contrary effects while walking or in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if it is a prominent bone in place of the injured body part, then you should proceed as follows: take a thread and tie it at the end of that prominent bone; and order someone to extend that thread; pause with another thicker piece of thread after the first one; and then wrap the thread over the flesh near the bone, extending its ends so that you pull the flesh towards the sides; and thus expose the flesh where you wish to cut so that the scissors do not injure the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	Place the saw or table below the bone properly, for when you do this, it is not forbidden to use the saw on the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	You should place the saw on the slightly corrupted area little by little, for if there is corruption in the concavity of the bone and it does not appear to the senses, then force the saw from the other side.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not prominent, and it is one continuous part with another, and the corruption is in the middle or part of it, then you must uncover the flesh from all sides completely; then place the saw below it, and then saw off the first part where the corruption is until the sawing continues from the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	Place the saw according to the location of the corruption, as we have said, a little at a time.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw off the bone where it continues from the other side.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not within reason but is extraordinary.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the center of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, you must investigate how the corruption appears to you, and then expose that area, and clean that area according to each possible disposition, and whenever an extraordinary case arises, correct it as long as it does not come into conflict with veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know which incision tools and saws to use for these bones, as they vary according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, their thickness, their fineness and size, their hardness and rarity; therefore, it is necessary that you prepare appropriate instruments for each type of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that the operation signifies to you according to the kind of instrument of which you need; when you are great in study and long and knowledge of the methods of this art, and witness of ways of diseases, then you have by yourself what is appropriate to each of the instruments for every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I tell you forming at the end of this chapter the number of the instruments which you will place as simples among which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experiment upon the others.
Forma de serra:	Form of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:  
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Form of a needle:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this needle be in the shape of a star-shaped keyhead, and let its points be in the form of stepped points.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not sufficient unless the heads of the joints are rubbed with them when they are corrupted, or if the mouth is large and wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of a larger razor than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of a broad razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another saw properly made: let it be made with the top part curved upwards and the sharp edge made of iron, and the handle made appropriately like a knife.
Forma de lu:	Form of this:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Form of a razor in which there is a concavity:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Form of another subtle razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Form of another razor with a curved tip:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Form of a small razor resembling a tentacle:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Form of scissors used to cut bones:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Form of another smaller pair of cutting instruments:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another pair of cutting instruments; this one resembling a needle, and the tip of it is like a saw, and it is displayed in appropriate words in proportion to the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of the ligature which is suitable for the ratio of that which is pierced through the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and seemingly it suits all the causes that we have mentioned about knives, scissors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	About the cutting of extremities and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Extremities may need to be amputated either due to an intrinsic cause or an extrinsic cause; or when you have treated the corruption with healing medicines and the treatment does not succeed, or when the corruption spreads from a member without any reason, then it is necessary that you cut off that member up to where the corruption reaches, so that the patient may escape death or serious harm which would be a greater evil than the loss of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign for that to which it happens is that the member turns black as if burnt by fire, or the corruption spreads close to where the blackness appears before the rot reaches the dry part of the limb and spreads throughout the body; therefore, you must perform amputation on that limb.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the corruption is a bite or sting from some venomous creatures such as a scorpion, viper, adder, or similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the bite is at the extremity of a finger, then you should amputate the finger and not give space for the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it affects the hand, then you should amputate at the joint of the wrist and not give space for the corruption to spread into the elbow joint.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you encounter that [condition], then cut the arm at the joint in the collarbone.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption spreads around the collarbone, then death is imminent for the patient; and to treat another condition requires another cause in this cure, which is the quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, when corruption affects the foot, then you must cut it at one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it affects the sole of the foot, then you must amputate the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it penetrates to the toenail, then you must cut the toe at the joint of the nail.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toenail, then there is no remedy but dismissal, and leave the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of cutting off a limb or tying it is that you tie a tourniquet above the part where you wish to cut, and another bandage over the area; and extend a bandage to the parts below, and have another bandage extended above; and you separate the skin which is between two bandages with about one finger’s breadth until all the flesh is exposed; and then it can be cut or tied.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to cover the patient with a cloth from all sides so that it does not touch the affected area, and to ensure that the wound is properly dressed and the abscess cauterized.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flow occurs when you are working, then you should cauterize the area immediately, or apply some powders to stem the bleeding; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Apply bandages to the injured limb as is appropriate, and take care of it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you to treat the person who is injured in his place, this year due to an accident for which I advised you, an accident that resulted in blackening of the skin as if it were burned by fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption from the accident initially affects the skin inside the finger and tends to spread over the entire body.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then the person prepares for that year's pus to go out of the member along with the intensity of what is blackened by pain and burning, and he cuts that skin at the joint, and it will heal.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long ago, this annual corruption affected the finger of the indicated hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it happened to me, and I had to remove that excess according to what I prescribed for the treatment of the hand with regard to the cleanliness of the body; and the excess was not removed, and it began to spread to another finger on the same hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to cut off the hand, but I did not want to do that, hoping for the removal of that excess, and fearing that cutting off the hand might lead to death, as the power of the poison was very strong.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his own land, and I was told that the man prepared and amputated his entire hand, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have included this narrative only to assist in understanding the nature of this illness and to provide guidance on how it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of hemorrhoids and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the space of the abscess is extended inward so that it forms a collection of pus, and then it bursts and perforates, and the pus is discharged from there, leaving the place empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin above it remains thin like cloth, and has not yet reached corruption, nor does it impress upon bone or nerve or tendon, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space extends inward so that corruption impresses upon some member, now it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to incise that skin completely as it has been formed, and especially when it is thin like cloth, and ensure that you do not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you hope that the skin will adhere and that the corruption has not yet reached its final stage, and there is pus passing through the skin, now you should treat it with enemas.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And when you consider the sinus, if it is large and the arm that you are using smells foul, then treat it with an Egyptian medicine which consists of oil, vinegar, and rue in equal parts, and mix them together in a vessel, and cook them over fire until the medicine becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take the amount that is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; use this to administer an enema to the sinus, plug the opening, and leave the medicine inside for the duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	From there extract that which is held in little regard; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pus is evacuated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And on some occasions it is administered as an enema with water of ashes, when this medicine is not present at your disposal; and you should take the ashes of wheat, put them over the water; and then filter that, and administer it as an enema until you are confident that the sinus is now closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then administer it with water and honey mixed thoroughly three times; and administer it with vinegar and honey mixed, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and the vinegar makes the sinus adhere, especially when the vinegar has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this on some occasions and become confident that the sinus is now evacuated, then administer an enema with something that promotes flesh growth.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take of the decoction of dyafinicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent vinegar; or administer that along with some medicines and other decoctions which have the properties I have already written about in the chapter on decoctions.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and does not allow the enema tube to be received, then you should gradually widen it with a small instrument, and pause in the procedure wrapped in Egyptian or basilicon decoction until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you should bring together the edges of it with a suture and leave it in such a way that the enema can be administered without addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening of the hole from which the arm protrudes is raised to the upper parts, then dry that in the pus base located where the arm runs below, for when the arm is constricted in the depth of the bend the flesh will be generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinus beneath around the pus base as you wish, then perforate so that you prepare the member for the preparation by which the arm protrudes lightly as you are equipped and without any cause detaining the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that should be applied to the sinus appropriately so that you can extend them over cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such quantity as to cover all of the sinus; then carefully cut with scissors along the edge of the sinus opening a bit wider than the opening itself; then extend over another piece of cloth some ointment according to the size of the slit, and place it in position at a distance from the sinus opening so that the arm movement is not hindered by the large cloth but only after several days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the sinus opening, which you must change at all times so that it dries what is inside the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know whether what protrudes from the arm is much or little, or whether it is digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And with this, you should consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and whether there is an abscess present.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the material placed over the sinus opening has adhered or will soon adhere, then on the third day loosen it, and when you loosen the dressing, change the cloth to another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	If the sinew is very close to the skin and the pus is thin and subtle, do not despair of its adhesion, for it will heal properly. For there are some people in whom the generation of flesh in their sores takes a long time, and others in whom the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinew remains separate from the skin for many days and is still indigestible, then you should know that the sinew does not adhere. And if the adherence of the sinew is delayed and this is due to a prolonged cause, then adjust in drying the medicines; and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they must be dried as well when it is adjusted, for there is superfluous addition of grease.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And when the pus is to be treated, take what has been purified and dissolve it in rose oil. Then apply it over the wound with another substance that has similar properties, and use it accordingly.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems appropriate in that action, when there is no skin, to take purified substance and honey, and when it is cooked so that it thickens, use it. Or take myrrh and aloes and sendes, mix them all together, powder them over the honey which is on the fire, and then apply this over a cloth and bind it; or apply the honey you have cooked until it thickens, sprinkle it with powder over a cloth, and bind it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is administered with long-leaf artemisia and seeds of lilies (and celestial lilies) and flour of oats and centaurea, using those simple or prepared ingredients, mixing them together, sifting them, powdering them over the recommended honey; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and is not healed by this treatment, then you know that the corruption is in its root, and it has spread to the bones or other hard members or to the ligaments; now treat it with a fistula treatment as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of boilings and chafed nails and the cutting of an added finger and division.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A boil is an abscess that typically arises under the nail of a toe or finger, and it can also occur in other fingers. If it persists and its treatment is delayed, or if it is an abscess caused by cautery, or if it becomes corrupted, it may secrete pus internally which corrodes the root of the nail. It often corrupts the entire area, sometimes spreading to the bone inside, causing a foul odor, and rendering the end of the finger or toe useless, turning its color dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have applied the treatment as we described in the division and it does not improve your condition, then you should incise with a scalpel all the superfluous tissue that is decayed under the nail and immediately cauterize the wound, for immediate cautery is beneficial in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the addictions of the nail have withdrawn and the flesh around it begins to hurt and inflame, then you should place a fine probe under the part of the nail that hurts the flesh, elevate it, and incise the flesh with ease. Then apply corrosive remedies to what remains of the flesh until it is completely removed; and afterwards treat it with ointments until it heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already penetrated the bone, then you should incise the bone and extract it, because it is never healed when the corrupted bone remains.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption spread to the finger, then you should incise it at one of its joints according to where the pain is felt, and afterwards treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is a puncture or abrasion on the nail and it causes severe pain, then at the beginning you should bleed the patient, and afterwards dry the nail with a sharp instrument in a transverse cut from top to bottom, but be careful that the cut does not reach the flesh beneath the nail, for you would cause intense pain to the patient, and it would lead to the formation of excessive scar tissue in the area; and then treat the affected area with something that alleviates pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But in the case of a swollen finger, which occurs in many people, it is often full of flesh, or it is soft on the bones, or it is often in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them arise at the root of the joint, or it is the swelling in some joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But the one that arises in some joints of the finger is not serious, and the one that arises at the joints is more severe.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshy swellings, the incision is shallow, and you should make it behind the base with a broad instrument.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for the one that arises at the root of the joint, the treatment is difficult; therefore, be careful not to amputate it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In that which is described about nuts, you should incise the flesh at the beginning with a round incision into the bone, and then use one of those saws suitable for this purpose, and then treat what is within so that it may be healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	In the case of consolidation that occurs between the bones due to scarring from injury or because of the person's birth, or due to consolidation from illness or fire damage, then you should treat that consolidation until the mentioned parts return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between the strips of the enfused in rose oil so that they do not consolidate too quickly, and separate them, or place between them a thin sheet of lead until they are consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in some of the mentioned parts on the palm, then you should treat that consolidation according to how it is prepared and suited to the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	For incisions of veins, these are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varicose when they are swollen and full of melancholic humors that flow to the limbs of the body, and their primary occurrence is in the legs, especially in the legs of those who travel, work, or carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer purgation of the body with black hellebore several times to strongly expel it, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment for them involving iron is according to two methods: one is that it should be incised and the black blood drawn out, and the other method is that the vein should be raised and completely extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section of the procedure is as follows: at the beginning, place a basin under to catch what comes out so that the thick blood is resolved, which is sediment in the basin. Then apply the basin to the most pus-infected part of the wound below the bone with a bandage and then make an incision wide in one place or two places or three. Then lift the black blood with your hand from below the basin up into it as much as you want and as often as is necessary until the quantity of blood has been removed that you wish and that the patient's constitution can bear.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then give him some food and order him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And iterate the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and inform the patient about this.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	However, the elevation of it is as follows: if you see that the patient's basin has hair and then place him in a bath or apply hot water to his basin until he blushes and the veins are swollen; or have him exercise strenuously if a bath is not available, until the limb becomes warm.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry the area on the side of the vein by making an incision either at the end or behind the bone, or at the lowest part near the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then scratch the area with hooks and scrape the vein from all sides until it appears to the touch, and it should be observed that as you treat it, it gradually turns darker.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus when you examine it, look for the white part that feels firm.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Place then the knife upright so that it is raised and angled from the rib cage, and suspend it there for one hour.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then cut another section near that section for three reasons, and then peel the rib cage above the vein that appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then raise that and incise it in the rear section near the heel, and then extract it and raise it until it exits through the second section, and then extract it from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract it from the section that is highest or farthest from all sections, until it all exits; then incise it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not manage to extract and raise it, then insert a strong double-threaded needle and pull it out, or insert the knife below and rotate your hand in all directions until it is dislodged.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it will be difficult to raise that piece, and the patient will suffer from that harm.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have completely removed it all, then apply to the wound wool soaked in wine and rose oil and plain oil, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vessel is contracted with twists for which it has a covering in the parts, and it is not straight as we have said, then you should cut along each twist of it and at the places where it is covered, and then suspend it for an hour until you raise it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself in your section that you do not incise the vein and that you do not obstruct it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incident by which the operation is performed:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of applying ointment:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to be made as sharp as a scalpel nor with a pointed end so that it does not obstruct the vein; and it should have great flexibility, for if it were delicate, it would cut the vein because of its delicateness; however, it should not be excessively thick as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the camels in warm lands such as Al-Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the warm and dry lands of India where no grass or food grows.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And similarly it is generated in other parts of the body besides the camels.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its gestation is from putrefaction that occurs below the skin, just as worms and vermin come from within the body of serpents and other creatures, generating between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the occurrence of it is that this vein causes inflammation in the camel; near the location, blisters appear; and soon the vein begins to emerge from the place of those blisters, resembling a plant sprout.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the extremity of it becomes apparent, then you should wrap around it a piece of lead weighing one drachma within two drachmas, and secure that area, leaving the lead suspended from the camel.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And so many times when you need something for the parts outside, wrap it in lead and attach that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is elongated, then you cut a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut that which is ragged until it has come out, for if you cut that which is ragged it contracts and goes into the flesh, causing an abscess, putrefaction in the place, and a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	It is necessary that it be treated gently and be extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the rear of it and there remains nothing of it in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein is found in some people extending to the length of five palms and I have been told that it has reached up to twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert the reed into the tract and perforate that which is long in the body until all that is inside the material is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the area with medicines for several days; and afterwards treat that as you would an abscess.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and it comes to multiple openings, and is branched from each opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat that as we have said in the division and according to what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section on worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called in some lands bovine disease because at times it appears among cattle and is a worm that is born between the skin and the flesh, and moves throughout the body up and down, and is shown through the sensation near the affected part of the member by member until it breaks the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Regarding the generation of worms, it is through the putrefaction of certain humors, just as happens with worms and serpents and maggots and pinworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared because of its malice, for when it goes into the body and rises to the head, and reaches the heart, then suddenly a very light wind blows in it and enters and destroys the heart, and thus many deaths occur.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And when you wish to cure that and extract it, then it is done only by means of the movement and appearance of it to the senses, and at that moment you should press what is above it and what is below it with a bandage and strong constriction, and immediately dry over it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is hidden in the flesh and you do not find it, then you should pause and cauterize with fire over the place where it resides, and the main cause to be feared is the corruption of it by which it corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that it has reached the head near the heart, then press above the eyebrows with strong constriction, and immediately dry over it, and extract that; and it is necessary for the patient to use purification of their body with medicines evacuating putrid bad humors, and guard against foods generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Regarding the treatment of nasal illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called "nafir" in our land, and it is pain that occurs in certain limbs, and then it is transferred from one limb to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that as I will now recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I went to see a sick woman in a village, and uncovered her arm, where I found a small inflammation in the funis vein of the arm. After removing it for about an hour, I saw that this swelling subsided as quickly as wax melts under heat, but more rapidly than could be expected, as if it were living silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then the pain moved from that location to the muscle, and it remained there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it quickly moved to the other side of her body and reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then she told me that it was moving throughout her body just as I had observed, and I was greatly amazed by the change and the speed at which it moved from one limb to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had seen this before in my own patients in the manner described, but I have never witnessed such rapid pain moving from one limb to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in my patients as I did in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I thought this was due to the fact that the woman was elderly, with weak limbs and exposed veins, and in her, this windiness appeared as changing sensations.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this does not appear in those who are delicate and have moist bodies with engorged veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat it and the patient feels that pain, immediately apply heat to that area as we have said, then press firmly on it until the confined windiness is expelled, and cauterize the location.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you do not apply it to your wounds, then treat that with massage of the body and with what expels windiness, and anoint those with stinking pills and with Serapion pills and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of splinters.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Splinters are diverse according to their types and the parts of the body where they lodge, for their diversity is such that some have large points, others small, concave or blunt, solid ones as well. And there are those with three angles, and among them are those with tongues; and also slender pieces.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and parts of the body where they lodge is in two ways: for the members or principal members concave, such as the brain, heart, spine, lungs, ribs, bowels, bladder, and similar; therefore, when you find one of these members affected by a splinter and signs of death appear to you, which I will explain shortly, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting the splinter from those in whom death quickly follows such major conditions. And when no such bad signs appear to you and the splinter is not hidden deep within the member, then you extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of the brain when struck by a splinter and it penetrates the bone, and exits at the fontanelle which is above the brain, are caused by severe heat, scotoma, vertigo, rigidity in the wounds, inflammation and redness of the tongue, spasms and confusion of understanding, vomiting of bile, and often speech is cut off and the voice destroyed. Moisture similar to flour exits from the affected area, and the appearance indicates an abundance of fluid in the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if I recognize these signs in you, then refrain from treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	Note the signs of the arrow when it hits the heart, so that it is near the left nipple, and feel how it is lodged in a hard place, not soft tissue; and the movement of the arrow is similar to the pulse movement, and there is black blood from the wound, and the extremities become cold, and sweating occurs, and fainting; therefore, you will know that death approaches very soon.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung are frothy blood from the wound, and the veins near the neck become swollen, and the patient's complexion changes, and they exhale a great breath, and crave for fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow hits the membrane that is in the legs, and the pain at this moment is near the small ribs, it causes great distress and severe pain and sighing, and there is no movement of any part of the limbs.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow hits the stomach, then very quickly you will see that the wound expels any undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow hits the abdomen, and it is lodged there, you will see some opening from the wound, or the membrane, or the intestine which is ruptured, and there is no hope for recovery from the treatment or extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow hits the bladder, and urine comes out from it, and some cause of infection spreads to other parts externally, and quickly there is pain over the patient, then you will know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Thus the other members as well as in the face, the neck, and the groin, and the shoulders and the helpers, and the vertebrae of the back, and the collarbone, and the ribs, and similar parts of the limbs are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not find a vein or artery and is not a poisonous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you as I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand about their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason for this is that an arrow was embedded in the lacrimal bone at the root of his nose, and I extracted it from the other side, leaving behind only the grey matter of the ear, and he healed without any harm coming to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew, which had embedded in him at the grey matter of his eye, leaving behind only the eyelid. The arrow was already concealed and could not be completely removed except for a small part to which it adhered to its shaft. It was a large sharp arrow of the Turks, with a lion-shaped iron tip that did not have barbs.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew recovered, and no harmful incident occurred to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who had it embedded in his groin, and it was an Arabic arrow with barbs. Then I incised around it between two grooves, and it was already submerged in his groin. Then I carefully removed it, and the Christian man recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had it embedded in his abdomen, and he was thought to die because of it. However, after thirty days had passed and there was no change in his condition regarding the arrow, I incised around the arrow and removed it carefully, and he recovered without any harmful incident occurring to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And in one man an arrow was embedded in both sides of him, and the wound had healed over it, and after seven years the arrow emerged at the root of his spine.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And there was a woman in whom an arrow had penetrated her abdomen, and the wound had healed over it internally, and she did not change in any of her conditions regarding it, and the woman did not suffer any discomfort during any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And there was another man in whom an arrow had penetrated his face and the wound had healed over it, breaking off the arrow, experiencing no pain hereafter, and similar cases are like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And the arrow was extracted from the man who was the prince of the king; it had penetrated just below his nose, and it had slightly shifted towards the right side, and the entire arrow was concealed beneath the skin.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him regarding the embedding of the arrow within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the wound of the arrow quite narrow; and then I examined it carefully with a probe, but did not feel anything with it; however, he felt pain just below his right ear, and then I suspected that this pain was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a plaster to the area containing an ingredient that attracts and digests foreign bodies, hoping that it would cause the location of the arrow to become apparent so that I could operate on it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant change occurred in the area that would indicate the arrow had reached it; and I continued to apply the plaster for several days without any incident; and meanwhile, the wound healed, and he complained of pain from the tip of it after some days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and informed me about this.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.
