Then I applied a sharp corrosive medicine for several days until it reached the bone, and when I tested it, I found that it had penetrated to the fine extremity of the sinew, which adheres to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then I adjusted the incision of the wound with that sharp medicine until it became visible to me clearly where the tendon ends, and it took me some time, over a period of four months, to complete this.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And as the wound reached a certain size and it became possible for me to insert forceps into it, I did not immediately remove it but rather continued to refine and devise methods of extraction until one day I began to extract it using specially made forceps, according to the form described at the end of this chapter; and then I restored the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I did restore it, and the wound healed properly, and the patient recovered completely without any further cause for concern.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I advise you about the quality of extracting certain arrows in order to establish this rule and its significance regarding what I have not mentioned, since the parts of this art and the definitions of them are not comprehensible through mere narration or without referring to the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And skilled artisans compare with a few words; and with what is present concerning what is absent; and they discover new operations and new instruments from the descent of causes foreign to the art when such occasions arise.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore, I say that arrows are not extracted from the members in which they are inserted except in two ways: either by attraction to the place where they enter; or by the opposite part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	Of that which is wounded by the place where it entered, or is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy place, and is drawn out and removed.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if he does not obey the order to remove it at the hour when he catches it, you should leave it for some days until the flesh around it heals, and reduce its traction and its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is embedded in bone and he does not obey the order to remove it, you should leave it for some days and gradually reduce its traction and movement each day until it can be removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if he does not obey the order to remove it for some days, then you should perforate around the arrow in that bone with a fine awl until the place is enlarged around the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has penetrated one of the cavities of the brain, and if the injury exhibits any of those symptoms I have mentioned, then abstain from removing the arrow and leave it until his condition stabilizes for some days; for if the arrow remains in place, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is embedded only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the brain, and the injury remains for some days without any of those harmful symptoms occurring, then you should manage the traction of the arrow and his condition.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is firmly embedded and he does not obey the order to extract it, then you should administer probes around the arrow as we have recommended, and subsequently treat the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is already hidden in the body and has escaped detection by sensation, you then probe for it, and if you feel it, you now direct it towards some instrument which is suitable for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the arrow shaft, and there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein here, then incise around the wound so that it is enlarged and the arrow can be extracted.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is held by the ears with those parts attached to it, then remove the flesh in which it is embedded as completely as you can; and work on this, if you cannot avoid cutting through the flesh at the fracture of the ears and twisting them until it comes out.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow from wherever it is, then use twisting with your hand and forceps in all ways until it obeys; and carefully with the utmost care that the arrow does not break and that it be made easier to attract it and extract it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot manage this at your current time, then leave it for several days until the parts around it become less swollen and try again when the situation is more favorable.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if there is an adverse flow of blood, then you administer what we have said about treatment in the relevant chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard against cutting into veins or nerves, or tendons, and administer treatment in every possible way to avoid cutting the arrow; do this with ease, calmness, patience, and firmness as I have advised you.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, you should bend the probe according to the figure of the patient's condition so that the fire of the cautery may be applied to it in a more beneficial manner.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If that is not possible for you, now administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	However, for probes that are removed in the opposite direction from the other side, or if you have already processed some part of them outwardly, or if there is hardness near the end of the probe due to tissue above the bone being pressed and you lift that area; then you cut it there. The cutting should be according to the quantity taken by the forceps, and then pull out what has been cut since it will now be lighter in this way.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	However, if it is retained in the bone, now twist the probe in the opposite direction to which the probe entered into the bone, and widen as you remove it, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for several days, and then attempt to remove it when the condition improves.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the probe is in it, now push it out with force.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	However, if the shaft is embedded and you want to administer pressure, now insert and use it, if it is blunt, a concave instrument so that it fits into the curvature of the probe's head and then push it out with force.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	However, if the probe is concave, now push it out with a strong instrument by inserting it into the probe, for the probe will be easier to remove with this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the bandage is poisoned, then you should change all the flesh in which it was placed, if that is possible for you, and afterward treat it with what seems appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the bandage sticks to the feet, or to the belly, or to the bladder, or to the side, and is so adhered that you touch it with the probe, and if it is possible for you to cut over it, then cut over it and guard against cutting into a vein or nerve, and extract it, and afterward treat the wound as seems necessary, and cure it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which bandages are removed:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the ends of them be shaped like the beak of a bird so that when they grasp the bandage, they do not let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And from these are made special hooks, large and small, according to the size of the bandage and its thinness or thickness, and according to the width of the wound and its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of an impelling concave at this end curved like the claw of a bird so that it aids in the instrument entering the bandage, and the push of this hook:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of an impelling hook at the end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like a rod so that it aids in the instrument entering the curved bandage and is pushed with it.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	About phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for phlebotomy of which the blood is commonly drawn are as follows: xiii in number, and there are sixteen in the head. Among these are two pulsating veins close to the ears, called alhasisain; two veins that appear on each temple; and two veins near the tear ducts under each eye, which are called aspicientz; a vein located at the middle part of the forehead; a vein at the tip of the nose; two veins in the neck; two veins on the upper lip; and two veins on the lower lip; — these latter are called algelic; — and there are also two veins beneath the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Here are the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms: one of these is cephalic, and it is called wild rose; and people call it "the vein of the head," and sordas, and it is a median vein, and it is composed of one branch of basilica, and another branch of cephalic; and they name that one people "vein of the whole body"; and basilica is a vein which is placed on domestic rose, and it is called "cubital," and common people call this one "vein of the belly"; and flexor of the arm, and it lies over the humerus, and it is in that one in which bloodletting is performed, and it appears above the wrist by a manifest appearance; and savattella, and it is the vein that is between the thumb and the smallest finger, and it runs along both sides.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the ankle there are three veins: one of these is behind the curvature of the elbow of the wild rose; and the second is sophena, and its place is behind the heel of the domestic rose; and the sciatic vein, and its place is behind the heel of the wild rose; and in the ankle there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of the veins near the ears is for catarrhs, chronic illnesses, emigrations, scabs, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those veins is as I recommend to you: it should be done at the top of the patient's head, and the patient's head should be rubbed in the occipital area where both veins are with a large cloth with good friction; then strengthen the patient by holding their neck with a bandage so that the two veins and their locations near the ears appear in two places on the back of the head; and you must do this with your thumb, and if you feel the pulse of those veins with your finger, here is when to proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Take the lancet knife, and that is the one you should use, and then insert it below the vein into the bone until the blood flows to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand with the vein and the bone to the upper parts and incise the vein with an appropriate incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be as much as two fingers adjusted or around that amount; and let the blood flow out as much as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then apply powder and apply it there until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already in the beginning of the book, the incision of those and their cautery have been described.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But for the two arteries, the purpose of phlebotomy is to treat migraines from ancient origins and severe evil headaches and persistent acute discharges to the eyes.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those is as I recommend to you: instruct the patient to move their arm until the two veins become visible by clear appearance and feel the pulse below your finger; then proceed to test.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then raise the bone above the vein to the upper parts with your finger, and insert the phlebotomy incision below, and lift the vein up; and incise it as you did with the other two veins; and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then loosen the patient's restraint, and place your finger on the vein for one hour; then place it on that spot and apply powder and bind it tightly above with firm pressure, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	Thus is preceded the remembrance of them, and from that the incision, and the traction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And thus the benefit of phlebotomy from the vein of the forehead is appropriate for phlebotomy from the cephalic vein in ancient diseases of the face and to migraines, stiffness, and foul-smelling ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the phlebotomy is as I recommend to you; so that the patient should sit with their arm bound in a bandage until the vein appears; and then take the instrument which is called a fleam, whose shape is as follows:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the puncture point at the tip of the fleam above that vein and press it down with the hand or for another reason in the manner described, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you desire; and then release the patient from the procedure and bind that area until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And in some cases, it is opened with a phlebotomy on the lat (side), but it is not necessary for the phlebotomy to be sharp like other phlebotomies; rather, it should be blunt. Perform that phlebotomy acrosswise since the bone is close and strong, and it would easily break if the phlebotomy were too fine.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the benefit of the two veins that run along the tear ducts of both eyes is for treating itching of the eyes, stiffness, and excessive secretion in the eyes, and also for diseases of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient sits with their arm bound in a bandage, and then you perform the phlebotomy on those veins while you are standing over the patient's head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And let phlebotomy be performed transversely along a short stretch, for in that place there is no flesh; and if the vein is fine, the extremity of it will easily break off.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood flow as much as is necessary for you, and pause on those knots, and strengthen them for one night, and then release them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But phlebotomy of the nasal vein is beneficial for acute fever and violent chills, and for diseases of the face and migraines and stiffness that occur in the face, especially when they are chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient holds their own neck and then with your left hand hold their nose at its midpoint, and take a fine lancet and place it in the middle of the head of the nose along a straight line, for the vein does not appear to the touch here, and the blood will begin to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Move your hand slowly and gradually with the small phlebotomy tool and let the blood flow according to your need; then bind it for one night, for it is quickly restored.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the harm of phlebotomy on the two veins can lead to constriction of the eyes and the beginning of leprosy and many diseases and impetigo and severe corrosive ulcers, as well as herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of those veins is that the patient holds each one below their own neck with a band; and let the practitioner stand over the patient's head, and let the patient sit on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Regarding phlebotomy of the long vein, make a small incision gradually larger as needed; and draw blood according to the season or quantity required by necessity; and then treat the other veins similarly.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then remove the bandage and gently separate the two veins at the constriction so that the patient is not overly distressed, and leave it inside until the illness is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And for the benefit of phlebotomy of the larger veins, it applies to small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, corruption of the gums, bad ulcers, and fissures, as well as bad ulcers that occur in the nose and its surroundings.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	The quality of phlebotomy for these veins is that you should have the patient facing you, and secure their neck with a bandage. Then, pull back the lips to examine two veins: one on the right side of the lip and the other on the left; the identification of each is by the darkness of each vein, and this is especially true because in the area around them are small black veins. At that point, you should incise each vein carefully.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you are in doubt and do not know which one it is, then proceed with the incision of the larger of the two veins, and from the more evident pus.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And treat the two veins that are above the lips similarly.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	However, it is more common to incise the two veins that are below the lip rather than those above.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But for the two veins that are below the tongue, the benefit is in phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for headaches, diseases of the uvula, and illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	Of the quality of phlebotomy in that it follows the patient between your thighs before the sun, and raise his tongue, and look below his tongue, on one side of the vein and on the other side of the vein, and the color of each tends towards blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; and be careful not to proceed too far in the phlebotomy of these, for below these are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the bend where it is customary to do so in all men, and the phlebotomy of these is done in two ways, either they place a phlebotomy mirror with a blue or olive color tending towards subtlety; or use a sharp knife for phlebotomy, and feel if it hurts, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this pain indicates that the incision should be made according to their special side and subtlety, depending on the width of the veins and the tightness of these.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of phlebotomy mirror:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the cuts be made as needed, and it is appropriate to open the veins that are concave, full, and have obvious thick roots, and those that contain thick clotted blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the method of olive veinotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this veinotomy is of lesser width and has a more delicate tip, and it is appropriate for veinotomy of finer veins that contain thin, clear blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of veinotomy of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: for it extracts blood from diseases that burden the head and neck, and from what dries the legs and abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is appropriate for the phlebotomist, when performing veinotomy on that vein, to be very careful with it and to act with great caution, as there is an artery nearby. If he makes a mistake in the puncture of the veinotomy, he may cut into that artery and cause excessive bleeding. Therefore, one should not perform veinotomy on it with a sharp instrument but rather with a cutter like scissors.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear clearly, then it is necessary to leave that one and switch to another, or seek any branch that might be present; or perform veinotomy at the end of the arm, as this vein is clear there. And cut that with a veinotomy cutter as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria. The first of these is about understanding that phlebotomy should be administered only for the preservation of health and as a precaution against the onset of diseases. But if you are in the days of summer, then you are excused from putting your hand in cold water, and similarly, cooling the blood in cold water is paused during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than that of all other veins, because here there is no pulsating vein or nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the vein on the right hand is appropriate for diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that you tie your hand or someone else's hand, after placing it in hot water until the vein is swollen and clearly visible to the observer; then cut across that vein; and if you do not incise it entirely, this will not be effective.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And do not release your hand after the phlebotomy, for leave it so that the nerves of the aforementioned area bare of flesh are exposed.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then immerse your hand again in the hot water and let the blood flow freely there, for if you do not immerse it again in the hot water, the blood will clot at the opening of the vein, and the flow will be obstructed.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is extracted in the required quantity, then press on the vein with oil and salt, so that it does not seal up immediately; and similarly, you should do this for all such procedures.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of the phlebotomy of the vein on the left hand is that it is appropriate for diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in this phlebotomy as you have done in the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of the cephalic vein in phlebotomy is for diseases that affect the lower part of the body, such as disorders of the uterus, and for retention of menstruation, and for diseases of the joints and ulcers of old wounds, and similar ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	Of the quality of phlebotomy it is that the patient immerses his arm in warm water and makes friction thereon until the veins appear; and he places a cord above the joint of the arm where it bends, and the place of the vein to be opened is apparent below the said joints, and from this spot branches extend over the surface of the arm like little branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And so, phlebotomize the largest branch below the bend beneath the joint of it, for it is better and more effective.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize that on the surface of the arm, then be careful of the nerves which are below that on the surface of the arm, and pause your phlebotomy when you feel one, as if you wanted to cut across it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And so the phlebotomy is completed.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the emission of blood is prohibited; then immerse the arm of the patient in warm water and allow the blood to flow there until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs on the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy slightly above or below it, for the location is effective; and do not fear this error, but be cautious of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do the phlebotomy of the other arm in the same manner.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location as we have said is below the joint behind the thigh.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of phlebotomy is to alleviate pain in the hip when it is caused by excess blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	Of the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient enter into bath, and hasten and tighten the skin of him at the breadth between above the heel above four fingers in a bandage thin, for it appears not save by this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each angle that is possible and according to the transverse, and it is better; or incise that by incision or sever that by section, for the place of him is salt.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in words a man weak; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the sense of all, then phlebotomize some branch of him, and it is that which appears on the back of the hand behind the finger auricular and the finger anular.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity that you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the bandage and pause over the place of the phlebotomy cotton and tighten the place, for lightly it is healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of bleeding and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Bleeding is usually from veins, or arteries, or vessels.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And bleeding is done according to two methods: one of them is by incision and extraction of blood, and the other is bleeding without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this bleeding that is without incision is according to two methods, for it can be with heat or without heat.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for the veins that are usually administered with incision and extraction of blood there are fourteen locations on the body, among which one in which bleeding is paused is called alnocrati, and it is at the back part of the head; and another location is near both sides of the neck; and bleeding from the chin below the jaw next to the mouth; and bleeding from the two cheeks; and bleeding from alohoster, which is above the earlobe; and bleeding from two small veins, one on each arm; and bleeding from two tendons; and bleeding from two skin areas.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Of bloodletting do not extract the blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and by that you do not capture the virtue through those, just as it happens with phlebotomy; nor is it necessary for bloodletting to be done near fire or without fire in any disease caused by retention until the entire body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If necessity prompts bloodletting due to illness or continuously, administer that at any time at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and at some times.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in certain individuals, blood is multiplied within them to such an extent that it becomes necessary to extract it through bloodletting; and in those people, you find heaviness and congestion in their head. Of these, you notice retention and hardness in their face and head, and neck. And of others, you notice a pale complexion on their face and forehead, with darkness and dullness in their eyes. And there are those whose bloodletting site is congested; and among them, their laughter is excessive; and of some, you find a taste of blood in their mouth, or their tongue is coated and they spit blood. And of others, their sleep is multiplied, and there are those who see blood during sleep, along with rigors, fevers, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And when you encounter any of those causes, and particularly if it is in the third or middle of the month, I command that bloodletting be done after two or three hours have passed from midday.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The benefit of bloodletting from the neck is that when it alleviates heaviness in the head and what causes sinking of the eyes; but it should be done close to when the entire body is evacuated.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this incision is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic region.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not appropriate to use that which is of full circumference, or in which there is a catarrh, because it causes great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that reason, it is not advisable to use those that are old, and in which there are usually chronic illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But if it continues to be applied continuously over it, forgetfulness may occur; and for that reason, you should command the operator to pause their hand a little above the cup at the edges, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But cupping on the nape is in the place of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilic vein: and for that reason, it benefits asthma, constriction of breathing, rupture of the respiratory organ, coughing, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary for the cup on the nape to be raised a little, because if it is placed lower, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping on the back of the head benefits pain in the head and ophthalmia, headache, nasal congestion, and pain in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary to command the cupper not to press his hand near the incision so that he does not injure the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping below the chin benefits alcohol in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and symptoms similar to those diseases that are in the mouth, and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the alheric vein which is on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Make the ventilation which is made with the two spatulas according to the caphtan, which is made by an abundance of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventilation of the two parts inside the focus should be done with vigor for the phlebotomy of three veins, which are the basilic, fusca, and cephalic, because it attracts the blood from all those larger veins that are in the flesh, and these smaller veins from other thicker veins until the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the ventozator not to proceed with incision, because the area is bare of flesh, and leave it so as not to harm the nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventosa with which one applies suction over the hemorrhoids and uses it for ulcers while leaving them exposed.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is necessary to command the ventozator to use a large ventosa and let it be of medium size, because the area you are treating requires strong suction; and after applying powerful suction with larger ventosas, use smaller ones gently and perform incisions.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Use ventosas of the smaller kind with meticulous care, for they draw blood from the entire body, and apply them to chronic pains in the loins and back, and to the bladder; they also induce menstruation and are used for bothriosis and ademil; and they serve as a substitute for phlebotomy of two saphena veins, alahorcoben, and two cavilha.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the entire body and can cause syncope in some people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And for the alahorcoben ventosas, the vigor applied should be proportional to the vigor used with the two-sided ventosas.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	Regarding the quality of the position of the cupping vessels, place the cupping vessel at the beginning and draw it off promptly, and do not prolong the position of the cupping vessels, but place them gently, and leave them cautiously, so that the humors come to the site by event.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this and continue until you see the area turn red and swell, and the hardness of the blood becomes apparent.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Now you should make small incisions and repeat the suction gradually, and then carefully observe the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For the person with tender flesh and few pores should be scarified only once, not repeatedly, so that the area does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the cupper to enlarge the scarification slightly and prolong it a little, and apply suction with ease and facility.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify twice, because in the first session the path for the subtlety of the blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second session, proceed with the acquired scrutiny for extracting the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is murky and contains impurities, then perform the third scarification so that it achieves the desired result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or in small amounts, one scarification is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a large amount of blood, we perform extensive scarification; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to perform prolonged scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	Regarding the term of incision, in which the depth of the cut is only so much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the one whose cut is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, it is necessary that the areas for cupping be anointed with soothing, opening, and resolving oils; if it is in summer, such as aloes oil or violet oil, or olive of mustard seeds, or chickpea oil; and if it is in winter, narcissus oil, or lily oil, or camomile oil, or blood oil, and similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess is thick and congealed, then the oil should be henna oil, or balsam oil, or aloes oil, or anise oil, and similar ones.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping vessel has wide pores of tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and for this, the areas around where the cups will be applied should be washed with rose water or cold water mixed with solutrum, or chickpea water, or borretia water, and similar ones.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for the one whose blood is of thick moisture, wash their cupping areas with vinegar water, or with water of myrtle and sumac, and similar ones.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for the one whose excesses are thick, wash their cupping areas with old vinegar, or with water of savory, which is marjoram, or of anise decoction, or chamomile, and similar ones.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And it is necessary that the cupping be done before bathing; it should be administered immediately after bathing within an hour or two, and it is advisable to rest after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is needed so that bleeding may be regulated after phlebotomy before cupping.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider this at the beginning: if the venesectionist or the one who needs to be bled is choleric and there is wind over the hot blood with inflammation, then it should be that he takes cooling causes, such as sour grapes, endive in vinegar, lettuce, saffron, and julep, and things similar to these.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their food such as poultry, and meat of suitable birds, and foods seasoned with acids, and things similar to these.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for the one whose constitution is cold, he should drink rose syrup, or syrup of saffron from seeds, and sumac, and a mixture of moderate strength between noon and night; and it should be recommended to him to use little drinking and eating, and to pause foods such as poultry and canaries and sparrows and small birds and dove.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it should be that on the day of venesection and bleeding, drinking should be more than food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it should be given to drink at certain times to some people theriac alpharab, or medicine of musk, which is nutmeg, or alcelita before venesection or bleeding or afterwards, so that the principal members are comforted and that the blood becomes refined; and they should not take those hot substances.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	However, the venesections that should be done without incision should be performed on areas above the abdomen, over the liver and spleen, and at the navel, in the places of the ribs, and the pectoral region, because these members cannot tolerate incisions.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And this is not sought by those means but rather attraction of blood from a limb, just as we use a cupping glass on the breast in the disease of flux of blood from the nose; and they use that to dissolve the flatulence which inflames and thickens the limb, just as we apply it to the abdomen and navel; for that rarefies the limb and heats it up and removes the pain by resolving flatulence.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is applied to the sinuses when they are obstructed or diseased, for by virtue of attraction it raises obstructions and eradicates the disease from its location.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when applied to the liver and bile due to flatulence, which is enclosed within them.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cupping glasses are administered only with suction; and some are applied over fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some cupping glasses are administered filled with hot water in diseases of the bile.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the cupping glass may be full and larger; it can be hot water alone or water in which suitable herbs have been boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of the cupping glass administered over fire: let the width of the opening be two fingers wide, as we have formed it; and the quantity of its body shall be half a palm; and in the middle of it, in the place that is in the circuit, let it be half of it, the thickness shall be small according to the amount that fits inside a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of ox horn or citrus, with thick edges, lion skin, sealskin, and smooth so that it does not hurt the limb due to its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And place a candle across the middle of the lamp or iron, where it is set by the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this large suction device is greater than the one we have recommended; and its size should be adjusted according to the illness and the condition of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the suction devices for children and those who are weak should be different from those used by young and strong individuals.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this suction device over the fire on the limb is to extend the tube over the wood fire moderately in front of a small candle made of wax, and place it at the middle part of the cross bar in the proper location of the suction device, so that the flame is lit around the lower part without burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And it should be placed on the patient's limb, and the tube should be on the area we have mentioned, such that when we have the suction devices and do not want to hold the tube and allow the vapor to rise over that area, the suction device will dissolve quickly.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And light the tube according to its method, and repeat this if you need to use it again.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the suction device used for treating pleurisy, it is filled with water, in which there is no crossbar or tube, and it is administered only by being filled with water and placed on the limb.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: This suction device should be larger in size, as it can receive a greater amount of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter xcviij.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting should not be administered in movable parts but in those members where it is impossible to apply cupping because of their smallness, such as the gums and similar areas; or on fleshless parts, such as the fingers and nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that you have found in the clear waters downstream from clean places.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then leave them in clear water day and night until they are hungry, so that no cause remains in their belly; and then evacuate the body at the beginning of phlebotomy and cupping; and then rub the patient's limb until it reddens; and then place them on the affected area.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and satisfied.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if suction from the area with cupping is possible, it is better for improvement.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, now wash the area with warm water and then with moving water; and it should be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the blood vessels near the leech bites become extended and there is residual blood, now place a cloth on cold water, and apply it until the residue is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is flowing excessively, now sprinkle powdered vitriol or other astringent powders on it until the bleeding stops; or place masticated fava beans on the area, and leave them until the beans stick to the area, and the bleeding stops.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	In case it is necessary, repeat the application of leeches, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspending, at that time it should be washed with fresh blood or place a needle in the spots until blood flows; and then they should be paused, for those which feel any blood will immediately stop.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, powder over those a little of ground aloe, or salt, or ash, and they will stop immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the chapter of the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is repeatedly necessary in the art of medicine; it is the restoration of fractures and dislocations, accidents involving the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, be aware that those who boast about this chapter are foolish doctors and the unlearned, as well as those who for some time have not regarded the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this method of the scientists in our land is private; and I have not forgotten it for any length of time, nor have I acquired what follows except through prolonged reading of the books of the Ancients and studying to understand them, from which I extracted their knowledge.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I directed myself to experimentation and study throughout the duration of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that contains my knowledge and upon which I have passed my experience; now I abbreviate it for you to free it from the occupation of lengthiness; and I abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and I show it at the end of clarification; and form many forms of the instruments used in that, as is done by addition of explanation, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of what is necessary for the treatment of fractures of bones, from which a preliminary understanding is required before we begin to recall the parts of broken limbs and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us begin with the prologue of this chapter by summarizing the discourse; and the chapters will be such that at their beginning it is necessary for the practitioner to stand firm in the truth of them; so that you and those like you, who wish to know or learn this noble art from others, may do so promptly.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when it happens to someone to have a fracture or dislocation or torsion or fall, at that moment it is necessary for you to decide at the beginning whether to perform venesection or to bandage them, or both simultaneously, unless some cause prohibits it, such as weakness of strength, or if it is a child who has happened to them, or an elderly person in debility, or if it is a time of extreme heat or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let them be content with food that is light, such as fresh herbs and the meat of birds and small animals; we prohibit fatty meats and foods that fill the veins with blood, until you are sure that there will be no abscess or pus formation, and if you do not fear an effusion of matter into the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And now return the patient to their original regimen, which they were accustomed to before.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, now it is necessary that the patient be fed with nutritious foods that are moist and heavy, in which there is viscosity, such as food made from boiled wheat with water, rice, peas, beef tripe, hens, fresh pork, and similar foods, and with this regimen the healing of the fracture occurs more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones in children as well as in old age and in the first year of life cannot be set or consolidated by nature through the drying up of the members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are set and consolidated by nature at all times through the drying up of those members, and they remain set and consolidated until the end of their softness, just as the bones of small infants do.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and applies them around the broken bone for all parts due to a cause similar to glue, in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens until they are completely conjoined, until they come to an end of strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning, without any cause prohibiting it from completing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to avoid heavy foods and viscous foods that are thick, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The variety of fractures depends on the variety of the member.  
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the bone of the arm is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the thigh; and similarly all the other members are different among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And you will find a description of every kind of fracture, explained in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is diversity in the nature of fractures themselves.
