E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures are diverse in themselves; for one type of curved fracture is different from those that occur in the stars; and some fractures are made according to the length of the bone: and among the fractures of the shaft and splinters and non-continuous breaks, just as it is done when a pen is prepared for writing, there is a fracture due to plague and disruption in the head, and there is a small crack fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each type has its own proper treatment in the restoration, of which there will be a separate recall in their respective places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There is a sign of a bone fracture. 
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by water it is known whether there is a fracture of the bone: its twisting, and that elevation and appearance which are felt by touch, and what happens when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no visible twisting or swelling, it must be done by touch: when you touch the bone with movement and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There might be twisting or a small fissure, therefore do not press that with your hand and by compression of the whole area; however, place something upon it from among the medicines which are mentioned shortly before the moment when you will treat the location; and nearby it should be narrow due to subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you should know that the place where it is bent and not split into two or more of those that do not occur in its damage, as is described throughout this part of its comparison, then you should begin from your time to correct it, provided there is an abscess near it.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if there is an abscess near it, then leave that for some days until the abscess subsides; and afterward bandage it in whatever way you can with lightness and care.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you should know that the restoration and alignment of it are easier than for the bone in which such damage occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen that according to what will be recalled next.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if there is swelling in the bone due to damage, then it is necessary to extend this broken limb from both parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or by your hand if the member is small; or by two cords or one cord and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you place the limb in a location equal to its natural figure, while the parts so extended from the broken limb compel you to return those additions to their origin and according to each way that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful according to your strength that no harm falls upon the patient because of your operation or injury; and compel yourself according to your ability to apply one bone to its companion bone according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is fitting that at that opportune moment you touch with your hand that which needs attention, and if you find any divergent cause, correct that and equalize it according to the measure of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid excessive extension and compression, just as some foolish surgeons often cause an abscess to occur due to their operation, or cause contraction in the limb as we have seen happen due to their careless operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And promptly attach, promptly equalize and perform a proper operation and constriction of that limb, and rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and help them avoid anything that might harm it during their waking hours and while sleeping, and observe its movement and agitation, and manage all its movements with utmost care; and wait until the position of the limb is such that it ensures no pain, which often occurs due to an improper disposition of the painful or injured limb. Now it is necessary to change that limb to another disposition in which there is no pain; and be careful that this position is correct and equal, so that the limb does not suffer from curvature when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the tranquilized limb is what I recommend; for you to know that broken limbs vary in their smallness and magnitude and in the form of each one.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small like the arm and the hand and the finger and similar to these, then the wrapping should be of soft fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	And for those that are thick like the thigh or the calf, it is necessary that in these a wrapping of leather and something hard be used, because the leather wrapping connects the large and strong limb with tightness from all sides, so that nothing harmful can enter.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And immediately after you begin, after your evacuation of the wound, pause conveniently for this, on the place of that fracture with three wrappings or four as the limb requires; and tighten your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then bring it to the uppermost part of the place of the fracture, and tighten moderately so that your binding does not hurt the place where you have tightened the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then extend the wrapping of the place of the fracture a bit, and loosen the binding little by little, until you reach a large part of the area.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap that place of the fractured area again with a wrapping, and then go to the lower part of the wrappings from the fracture; and let your work be in tightening the binding and loosening it as we have said about the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the wrappings with a piece of cloth or linen on which the curvature of the fracture is equalized, if there is any curvature; and if not, do not pause for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause on the other bandage, and then apply plasters properly made shortly thereafter if there is no inflammation or abscess in the area, and at that time pause using what causes the abscess to form and reduces the swelling; and leave this for several days; and then you tighten over it the plasters.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	Let the splints for the middle of the reed shaft be well made skillfully; or let them be of oak wood; or of palm ribs; and let each splint be of this size and shape:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the splint that is placed over the fracture should be a little thicker and longer than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to how it fits the limb in size and smallness; then bind the splints together with a bandage as was described in your first dressing, and tie it above decently as we have said about dressing, and it should be that your dressing is tighter at the place of the fracture, and the farther it is from the fracture, the looser the binding.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And the threads should be of medium thickness and fineness, and they should be soft; if the threads are thick, as I have seen in some people's bandaging with cords made of twisted thread, it is a great mistake, for when you apply the dressing unevenly, it causes problems.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And similarly, very fine threads are not appropriate, for you will not achieve with the dressing what you want, and it should not be less than a finger's width between splint and splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient complains of pain at the ends of the splints near the dressing in those places, then place soft wool or knotted cloth underneath where it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	In some cases, a fracture is accompanied by bruising, and there may be disruption in the bone, and I will recall this in that chapter according to its particular nature.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that not every broken limb is dressed with splints on the first day; the reason for this is that when the limb is large, it should not be placed on splints until about five or seven days later, or more, according to your certainty of the occurrence of swelling.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of the plasters with which the Ancients restored fractures, dislocations, and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of a plaster made from bran for the restoration of fractures, suitable for complete bones and mostly for women and children, as it does not cause heat or irritation: take powdered bran, which is the fine flour that comes off the walls of the mill due to the movement of the millstones.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And prepare that as it is, but sieve it with egg white, and use the preparation neither too thick nor too thin.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method for a plaster that restores fractures, dislocations, and twists: recipe includes asafetida, lapidanum, acacia, hyssop, migraach (which is the seed of wild millet), each one drachm; myrrh and aloes each half a drachm; alochil two drachms. All should be powdered and sieved and mixed with almond water or egg white if the condition of the injury is hot; then use this plaster, as it has a good composition and restores broken bones quickly, suitable for men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for a plaster to treat fractures and twists: recipe includes migraach (seed of wild millet) and myrtle bark each one drachm; myrrh and aloes each half a drachm; acacia six drachms; Armenian bole two drachms.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All should be powdered in a mortar with a crushing tool, then sieved, and mixed with water or egg white and applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of applying a plaster to joints and bones that have come out of their places, and for pain resulting from these and for cracks and fractures: take clean wool and immerse it in vinegar and warm oil and place it over the site.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	In this plaster, there is no restorative virtue, but it is useful for suppurating sores and properly expelling pains.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of a plaster that restores a broken bone: take leaves of the mulberry tree and leaves of the wild poppy; mix them all and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of a quick plaster to be administered after the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want resolution of remaining abscess: take root of plantain, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of flour of spelt, of each one part; mix all ground and boiled in vinegar, if the member is not inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is inflamed, now mix that with coriander water or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of a stronger plaster for resolution than the first one, when there is a hard abscess after the restoration of the limb: take root of plantain and seeds of linseed, and buckthorn, melilot, marjoram, flowers of violets, chamomile, of each equal parts; all should be ground and boiled in sage water or in warm water or in vinegar, whichever suits the condition of the limb and the color of it.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates does not say in his book to apply it to the broken limb after its restoration except for wax made of wax and oil and nothing else; and recommends that it be midway between coarseness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	May is used from Gaulish wine which it is seen that they place over the broken limb after restoration due to the drying effect of its slight heat just as myrrh, and similar to those causes which we have recounted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of making a plaster for injury and pain: recipe using egg white, linseed, human hair cut or bird feather, oak bark, and salt, all in equal parts; they are ground, sifted, mixed together, and then made into a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount according to which it is necessary that the bandage remains and should then be loosened is such that you consider whether there has been no accident of pain or swelling, nor is the bone broken or displaced; therefore, do not loosen it for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there occurs severe pain or swelling at the site, then you should be cautious or loosen that bandage immediately, and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of cloth and sea sponge soaked in warm water, and immerse it in cold water, with which you wash the affected area until the swelling subsides and the pain is alleviated; then let the limb rest for one hour; afterwards place on it pure wool submerged in vinegar and oil or scented oil, and bind it over it for a night until you are sure of no abscess formation, and that the swelling of the limb has subsided, and the pain from it is relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then iterate that gentle wrapping and small plaster without tightening it as much as your first constriction, and gently treat it until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you find that the abscess and hardness and pain and swelling and all such occurrences have subsided completely, and you need a plaster and wrapping, then repeat that as you did at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause occurs to the member of those we have mentioned, then you do not loosen it but after three or four or ten or seven days; and sometimes all this is left loose for twenty days according to what appears to you in the loosening of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it becomes accustomed to the coagulation of flesh over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And now adjust in the constriction more than in your first constriction entirely, and adjust according to the swelling of the patient's flesh, as was previously mentioned.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the location of the fracture already drying and wasting more than is appropriate, then you will know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching it; therefore, apply tepid water to it every time you loosen it; do this for all three days; ease the constriction a little, and through this operation direct nutrition to the member, and it will be healed quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what those foolish restorers of the fractured member do otherwise when it is not restored at the beginning as appropriate and is restored according to tortuous methods, is an error according to their operation, and a great fear, and if this were true, it would greatly enlarge what the Ancients wrote about it in their books and warned against.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, so it is more reasonable to assume that they do not do this.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Second: On fractures when they occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct. Some fractures are caused by the impact of a hard object, which removes all the bone inward to the suture, leaving behind only that part of the bone, just as it would in wood; thus this type is called an incisional fracture. Or a hard object cuts some part of the bone and cuts through the flesh but does not penetrate beyond the surface; this type of fracture is called absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	This is about the severity of these two fractures, either major or minor, and of a fracture that is comminuted or crushed; and the cause of it is percussion by something weak or falling on a stone, and similar circumstances.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating, which approaches the periosteum below the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two fractures is either major or minor.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And this is a fracture that affects the bone in its subtlety, in the small fibers, and for this reason this particular type of fracture is called capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And this is a fracture that is caused either by falling or by being struck with a stone and similar circumstances, which causes some plate of the bone to enter into the soft parts inside, and it occurs in the concave location as well as when such things happen to the bones of the arm when they are struck and break inwardly.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is more commonly done in the bones of children's bodies, just as with the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And for all these types of fractures, treatments are used, which are remedies applied separately.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will return to the recall of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And you can recognize all these types of fractures by detection on them and by inquiry into their symptoms and the appearance of damaged flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary fracture is recognized by this: it appears on the bone, and when it is cleaned and examined with a probe, the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, consider at first the symptoms of the patient, and if you see from these symptoms that they signify by manifest indication fear, as is vomiting in anger, and stretching out, and loss of understanding, and hoarseness of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and similar such symptoms of the intestines and hardness of them, and likewise with other major dispositions, without doubt it will not be healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see unusual symptoms that give hope of health, then you begin the treatment of them.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause of which is clear if it comes to you as a complaint in the beginning as it is in winter days, then it is necessary that you study the condition of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then it is necessary that you wait to remove the bone before the seventh day, since what is around the bone may become corrupted by pus, and for the symptoms we have mentioned to occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the scalp covering the head and is in small pieces and scattered, then it is necessary that you incise the comminuted and scattered part as I will relate to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you should shave the head of the patient who is injured, and uncover the bone according to custom and method as best as possible according to the shape of the injury, so that it is clear on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that the detection of the bone, bleeding, or an abscess requires caution, then you must be careful with what is necessary, and it is that you cover the area with cloths infused in wine and rose oil, and allow the wound to rest until the abscess subsides, and you are sure there is no further bleeding; then proceed with circumferential treatment of the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	In this way it should be done according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you cut the bone with an incisor of such and such a shape, and this is its form: And then apply another incisor to it, somewhat wider than that; and this is the form of it.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply an even wider incisor than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary to have various incisors, some wider than others and some shorter than the rest; and their tips should be sharp, and they should be made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the incisors so that you do not injure the head and cause pain to it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, it is necessary to drill around it before you apply the incisors with the chisels, which are called non-profound chisels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are called this only because these do not penetrate to the end of the bone of the head as far as what is adjacent to it, so that the chisel has a rounded tip or margin on top of which is the part below the head like a margin or small circle, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a great number of these chisels, each of which should be suitable for the sharpness of each bone, so that you are present with all the parts of the head where the tip is sharp, and the quantity in length and width should correspond to the sharpness of this part.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the form of three kinds of trephines: The quality of drilling in the circuit of the broken bone is that you place the trephine on the bone and rotate it with your hands until you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then move the trephine to another location, and continue this process throughout to the amount of the thickness of the rib or around there.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then incise with the scalpel what is between each piece of bone, and make it as fine as possible at the end for lightness, as we have said, until you remove the bone, either by hand or for some other reason due to preparations made for this purpose, such as tools like probes and fine forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must be careful that the scalpel does not touch any part of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And when you have circled the bone with perforations, it will be separated from the brain if it is continuous there, and you will extract it; you should smooth and equalize that in the roughness of what is in the bone using a tool similar to a scalpel, but it must be thinner and finer than other scalpels.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small pieces of the bones remain and you are concerned about them, now take that with ease using the tools appropriate to you; and then treat the wound with lint and dressings as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other method of operation is light, distant from fear, which Guy of Chauliac greatly praised; and this is the speech about it: It is necessary for you at the beginning to start uncovering the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most severe, until when you have uncovered that part and you have placed below it the extremity of this slow and cheerful scalpel, whose form is as follows:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And so the lens-shaped part is solid and does not split for any reason, and the acute part splits it into two sides along its length, as you see; that the lens-shaped part fits to the bone with the cutting surface being sharp against the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And therefore strike with the saw on a small part to see if you can split all the bone with ease as it revolves, and be sure of the tissue that no accident happens in any way, and even if the physician were the most foolish of all people and the least knowledgeable among them; certainly, and even if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Now if any cause is attached to the bone of the tissue in some places of the bone, it will split that which is at the end of the saw that is lens-shaped, and deliver that which is with ease, for it is delivered without harm and without fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the bone fracture does not penetrate into the tissue, and what is split off or remains of the bone is its surface, and it remains rough with small irregularities, now you should file that roughness and eradicate those irregularities with fine razors for which you have prepared in various quantities so that you can apply them appropriately at any location during your operation on the broken bone according to its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you should apply in your proportion at which you file the bone at the beginning with the broader of those razors, and then use progressively finer ones, and do not stop doing this continuously until you reach applying the thinnest and finest of all.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	In each of the other small, slender fractures and subtle fractures, you should provide care according to what is required for their correction.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is true that not all who have studied in that art are capable.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this is about what we have written concerning large fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the fatty tissue is rectangular when you remove the bone, then take a piece of cloth according to the size of the wound, and immerse it in warm oil, and place it over the opening of the wound; then take another folded or triple-layered cloth and immerse it in wine and warm oil, and place it on top of the first cloth; and do this as lightly as possible so that you do not press on the swelling; and afterward apply a bandage to it, but tighten it only enough to cover the wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And keep it like this for one day or two until you are sure that no abscess will form; then loosen it and afterward administer medicines that are too drying, such as linseed poultice and flour of oats, and powder of vetches and of aristolochia, and similar ones.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you should make these medicines into a powder that is finely ground and apply them to the wound as dry powders; generally, administer any medicine whose property is to cleanse without irritating.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful according to your virtue that the wound in your treatment is clean; and it should not become infected or worse; nor should you allow its virulence to increase. For when it is pressed against the fatty tissue of the brain, it corrupts that and weakens it, and thus a serious illness may occur due to this malicious condition.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it affects the swelling of the head, as when the bone is cleaned and especially when pressure is applied to its treatment, and there is discoloration on its surface; and therefore consider whether it leads to the illness we have mentioned, knowing that it is harmful without any doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if the darkness does not come from the medicine that is placed upon it, but rather from the virtue of that medicine which causes the darkness, then you should take one part honey and three parts rose oil, and with these anoint a cloth, and then place that over the wound; and thereafter treat it with the spices suitable for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken in more than two parts at once above, or one of those rarely, because there are two bones there, since the part below is cartilaginous and does not break, but only ulceration, distortion, and swelling occurs to it.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you should introduce your finger into the socket of the nose, and align that fracture within with your middle finger, and press from outside, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this with ease, and be careful that your operation does not cause pain to the patient.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and your finger cannot reach it, then it should be aligned at the end of a rod with some thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you should proceed as described.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And attempt the restoration of it on the first day of the fracture if possible; and if not, then do so around the seventh or tenth day when the swelling has subsided.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Insert a piece of linen cloth into the end of the nose if the fracture is in one part, or two pieces if the fracture is in two parts, and let each piece be large enough to fill the cavity of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	One of the ancient restorers said that the pieces should be dipped in butter and changed every day, but I have not seen this done; however, it is advisable to dip the cloth in albumen from a cooked egg mixed with powder of flowers of malt; and then place it inside when the bone has set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	In some cases, a piece of ox horn wrapped in linen cloth may be inserted into the nose instead of pieces of cloth, especially if the fracture of the nose is very severe and the patient is not prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this method is not necessary for you; if you want to do it, do so, and if you prefer, use pieces of cloth.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another piece becomes inflamed, apply a plaster to the nose with cerate or cotton dipped in vinegar and rose oil, or with honey water.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if it does not become inflamed, now you should apply a plaster outside with sesame flour and powder of flowers mixed with egg white; and then place it over a linen pad, and do not treat the nose with any other substance.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or comminuted, now you should dissect around them and extract them with instruments suitable for that; and then close the wound, and treat it with substances that promote healing and consolidation, and with appropriate plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if it happens that there is an abscess inside the nose, now you must treat it with poultices and administer lead tubes within so that it may be completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jaw is broken and the fracture does not have an abscess, now observe if the fracture is only on the surface and not split into two parts and curved inward, then its diagnosis is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And you should therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, insert your left thumb into the mouth of the patient; and similarly, if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert your right thumb; and press against the swelling of the fracture inward with ease at the outer part with your other hand; thus gently restore it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, now you should administer extension of both parts according to straightness as much as possible until they are aligned.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is concussion of the teeth with disruption, now strengthen those that you expect will break with gold or silver or thread; and immediately apply cerate on the fractured jaw, and then apply a double cloth, and place a properly made bandage or a piece of sole leather equal to the length of the jaw; and then bind it above as is appropriate for your binding method and convenient application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use rest and tranquility, and give him food that is easy to swallow.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you think that the shape has already been altered in any way, then at that time you should cut it and loosen that on the third day; and immediately correct what has already been altered by it and plaster that with powder of myrtle, egg white, or flour of cumin, once you have laid the cerate on it, and place over the plaster lion's wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then as you apply and adjust that plaster over it, and the position of the bone has not been altered, leave it, do not loosen it until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for usually this fracture is cured in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if on another occasion an abscess occurs, then administer what we have mentioned often for its relief until it is healed, and let that abscess be drained.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with a splinter, then consider whether it is a piece of bone separated or embedded; then you should carefully extract those splinters with what is appropriate for that in the removal of such instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the splinter is narrow, then enlarge it with a scalpel according to the amount needed.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then when you have placed those splinters, and none of them will be drained, close the opening of the splinter if it is wide; and if not, place over it one of the plasters that are appropriate for this purpose until it heals.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Most often, the clavicle is broken in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Or it is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts without affecting the function; and it is easy to restore it. Or it happens that the fracture affects the function, and its restoration is difficult; or it is such that the fracture involves a condition.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture involves a condition, is such that you make two assistants present, so that one holds the patient's arm and supports the broken clavicle, and the other extends the neck towards that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then adjust the fracture with the fingers so that its shape is made according to what is necessary, and it should not have a slight prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then it is necessary to place under the armpit of the injured side a pad made of cloth or wool, and its size should be according to the quantity needed; extend and elevate the clavicle and compress the pad with your hand so that you can adjust the fracture as required.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the end of the clavicle to the outer parts, so that it reaches the preon, then the patient should be reclined on their neck, and place under the muscle a pad about half as large.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses the muscle below so that the bone of the clavicle is elevated to reach the preon, and then you correct the fracture and adjust it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel pain from the furcula and its joints, now is the time to cut into it and extract those irritations easily.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, now use your ingenuity to make an incision with one of the scalpels which you have prepared for this purpose, since you paused below the furcula with the instrument that serves as the ciphac; and this instrument is made of wood or iron, and its shape is as follows:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to the hollow part of a bowl, whose shape it resembles; and its width should be according to what you need, depending on the size of the bone or its scarcity.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it should be according to what is possible for the operation; let there be two ends as you see fit, and one end wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound you have incised when extracting the irritation from the bone is wide, and you are sure it will form a boil or cauterization, now you should approximate the two lips of the wound with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear it will form a boil or cauterization, now you should treat the wound with plasters and powders according to the extent of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess or cauterization occurs, now apply a plaster made of vinegar and rose oil mixed with vinegar, and place it over that area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the fixation of the bone when it is in a wound and its section is that you place a plaster made of flour mixed with egg white, and apply it to the stump of the bone, and then place a sphere below the tip if needed, and then take a bandage, which is called toraka by the Saracens, about as long as your palm or around that length; and its width should be about one palm. Then place double powder over the stump and the plaster; then take a thin board of which the width is three fingers wide and in length similarly; then wrap it with cloth, and wrap that cloth around the board at the site above the fracture site; then apply ointment as it is prepared, and roll it around the neck and below the tip as needed, and reduce it to all parts, and when you see that the fixation of the fracture with reduction has taken place, and this is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And do not let the splint be loose over the broken bone; and therefore see the patient every day, so when the bandage is loosened or you see the splint already moved, then you must correct this and tighten the bandaging.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And place the patient's pillow on his neck, and below him a cushion to raise his sleep position slightly during the night; therefore, in this way, lift the support of his chest, and thus elevate the fracture of the collarbone by raising the muscles; or bind his arm to his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the bandage unless you find an abscess in the area immediately or within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you see his face turned to it, and adjust around the constriction and restore it until it is set and the collarbone fracture is healed.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the measure in twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some people it is done in less time.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of a shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The bone is broken in the middle and not at the edges but along its sides.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when it is broken in that place — and it is broken in the middle of it — and it is known only by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture prepare him and reduce it according to its natural figure in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then pause over the place where you sprinkle powdered egg white and apply a lion's head bandage; and then pause with double-layered cloth powder; and then pause over the wound table, finely sprinkled according to the quantity of the spoonful, either all or at least a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if you leave the wound table slightly concave in some places of the spoonful, then you cover that concavity with a lion's head bandage, and then press the wound table evenly.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then apply a linen strip above with moderate tension and secure the wound table so that it does not move from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the bandaging each day; and every time it is loosened, reapply it and tighten it evenly if the wound has moved from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the dressing on its usual side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the wound will be healed in xx days or in .xx5. 
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number is completed, then you dissolve the bandage, and you know for certain that it concerns the bones of which the beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the place of the bone piece and place the chain below it, then you cut above it, remove it, and do as we have said in the fracture of the clavicle, should suppuration or cauterization occur here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of foot fractures.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes is broken in the middle and remains thus; but the extremities move as cicatrization and comminution occur.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents when the middle of it is broken, it inclines towards the internal parts and there occurs great pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, weakness, vomiting blood; and a cavity is formed in the broken bone and it is not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies supine on their back, and a cushion is placed between their shoulders; then gently press the muscles, and adjust the ribs by two or more ribs, and delicately perform the operation and the reduction in every possible manner suitable for this, until the figure of the bone returns as required.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place over it plaster and cotton, and place beneath thin splints of wood or reeds or similar light materials, after which you wrap that in cloth; and then gently bind that above the broken bone without pressing too hard; and go around the binding several times along the back, and tighten that with moderate firmness; and then examine the bandage at all times, and when it has softened, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity compels the removal of that which has been corroded or protruded or caused pain or an abscess in the area, then you should cut it out and remove the plaster and correct what has occurred by this method of treatment; and immediately replace the plaster, if you apply it to that part; and adjust the bandaging until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur except in thick parts where they join; and at their extremities, near the front part, compression does not affect them because they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And the knowledge of it is not hidden from the sense during the examination of the aforementioned ribs.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that it equalizes the fracture of the aforementioned ribs according to the possible method, until it is set as necessary, and then apply plaster and bind the broken bone with a splint if needed.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs inclines towards the inner parts, then severe pain and piercing occur, as with the pain that happens when one weeps, and because the bone pushes against the membrane; and difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting of blood result; and this is difficult to treat.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the Ancients were skilled in treating that with powerful remedies.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And what they say is: it is necessary to pause from foods that cause inflammation and gas, so that the abdomen becomes swollen and extended, and the fracture is pushed outward.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	Let us proceed with what will not be a cause of easy generation of an inflamed abscess if it does not occur; and if it has already occurred, now help is given for that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them say that it should be placed above the wound and close to where the strength is drawn; and this is similar to reasoning, but it is feared that the wound will draw the superfluities to the place due to its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some of them say: cover the place with wool that has already been submerged in hot oil, and place poultices between the ribs until it is full, making the bandage fit according to the roundness; and treat the ailment near where the lung disease from food and medicine is cured.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the cause of the ailment is forcefully constraining it so that it cannot be tolerated, and if the bone is pushed against the membrane with a puncture point, we fear for the ailment; now it should be that we cut above the location, expose the broken rib, and then place over it an instrument that secures the healing process, the memory of which precedes, and that they cut the bone with ease, and extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then we adjust the two edges of the wound, if it is large, with stitching, and treat it with plasters until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess occurs internally, now you should treat it and apply poultices in rose oil to the area, and treat the ailment with what is appropriate for an internal abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let him lie supine on the side on which he sleeps until he is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the vertebrae and the collarbone.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	In some cases, there is a fracture in the bones of the collar, and treatment for them is similarly applicable to the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when it happens to someone and you want to know if they will recover or not, at this time consider, for if you see their limbs already softened, stunned, and dead, unable to move them or extend them, and when you press on those areas with your fingers or pierce them with a needle and there is no pain felt in those areas, then you know that recovery is not possible, and in such conditions it is fatal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.
